column1: The team to play in any match was always put upon the notice-board at the foot of the stairs in the senior block a day before the date of the fixture. Both first and second fifteens had matches on the Thursday of this week. The second were playing a team brought down by an old Wrykinian. The first had a scratch game.When Barry
column3: who shared his study at Seymour's and rarely left him for two minutes on end
column4: passed by the notice-board at the quarter to eleven interval
column5: it was to the second fifteen list that he turned his attention. Now that Bryce had left
column6: he thought he might have a chance of getting into the second. His only real rival
column10: who was the other wing three-quarter of the third fifteen. The first name he saw on the list was Crawford's. It seemed to be written twice as large as any of the others
column11: and his own was nowhere to be seen. The fact that he had half expected the calamity made things no better. He had set his heart on playing for the second this term.
